profile_positions.description: −	Working with the Institute’s team on developing & implementing stakeholder mapping frameworks as well as developing action plans for collaborating with stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Research Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I have joined the Institute for Diplomacy and International Governance (London campus) as result of the Excellence 100 Doctoral Prize awarded to me. I worked on:

• developing a series of research outputs on EU diplomacy and EaP democratization (editing a Special Issue, a manuscript, (co)authoring journal articles, commentaries and opinion pieces). 
• coordinating the international research team on Resilience of the Eastern Partnership (EaP).
• organizing stakeholder engagement events (panel conferences, workshops, roundtables with practitioners).
• developing the research agenda on examining the practice of EU diplomacy in Eastern Europe.
• designing & implementing the curriculum on Diplomacy, Negotiations and Lobby modules.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
The activities of my company aim at building bridges between academics and the labour market by helping academics to develop their entrepreneurial thinking. Through workshops and trainings, the following needs are addressed:
•	Uncertainty in the academic job market;
•	Feeling uncomfortable when it is time to ‘sell’ oneself/one’s research project;
•	Fuzziness about relating to the market as an academic.

My services cover the following 3 themes:
•	Transferable Research Skills for Academics: to learn how to transfer you experience from the PhD and postdoctoral studies into generic skills on the labour market. 
•	Academic Storytelling and Pitching: to learn how (re)shape the storyline of your career path and how to craft their own narrative as well how to sell your skills to your target audience.
•	Marketing Tools for Academics:  to design your own roadmap and learn how to adapt to the new tendencies in the digital world and how to adjust your research profile to it.
profile_positions.title: Founder
Founder

company.name: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)

profile_positions.company: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
profile_positions.description:
Providing research, evaluation, networked learning and stakeholder enagagement consultancy services within the following project:
-- piloting of diaspora mobilization schemes in the education and research sectors of Moldova, part of the the European Union Global Diaspora Facility (EUDiF) - an EU-funded project running from June 2019 that aims to strengthen collaboration and engagement between diaspora development organisations, countries of origin and the EU.
I am working on developing a Roadmap with practical guidelines for the Bureau for Relations with Diaspora and Moldovan stakeholders in setting up a diaspora skills transfer scheme
in the targeted sector.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.company: International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD)
profile_positions.description:
Providing research, evaluation, networked learning and stakeholder enagagement consultancy services within the following project:
-- mid-term evaluation of the National Strategy Diaspora 2025, part of MIEUX+, the joint EU-ICMPD Migration EU eXpertise Initiative that enables institutions and experts to exchange knowledge on migration since 2009.
I am working on conducting an external assessment of the current institutional framework of the Bureau for Relations with Diaspora related to diaspora engagement, with a specific focus on the role and mandate of the Bureau and possible evolutions in the short, medium and long-term, including creating an Action Plan that will cover 2023 to 2025.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant

profile_positions.description:
This project fosters a community of female early career researchers and offers workshops tailored to their needs, building on their experience and expertise. As result of participating in these co-working workshops, 100+ female researchers became more competitive on the labour market through learning how to design their own digital footprint, to pitch their research results and how to transfer their experience from PhD/post-doc into generic skills.

The project was awarded with the UM Diversity & Inclusivity grant.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description:
Accumulated 4+ years of teaching& learning and academic coordination experience in European Studies, BA and MA level: 
•  Teaching expertise uded in the following modules: EU Policy Domains (foreign policy), EU external relations, International Relations, Comparative Politics & Government, Area Studies (Moldova), Negotiation skills, Interviewing skills and Qualitative Methodology.
•  Coordinated International Relations, Area Studies & Qualitative Interviewing modules; prepared lectures in 10+ different courses at BA and MA level and designed 30+ tutorials.
•  Supervised and reviewed circa 50 bachelor and master theses (European Studies and International Relations).
•  Mentored circa 30 first-year BA students and coached second & third year students for transatlantic negotiations competitions.
profile_positions.title: Junior Lecturer

company.name: Brussels School of International Studies (BSIS) - University of Kent

profile_positions.company: Brussels School of International Studies (BSIS) - University of Kent
profile_positions.title: NORTIA fellow

profile_positions.description:
Received the Marie Curie Fellowship within the European Commission-funded INCOOP project (Dynamics of Institutional cooperation in the European Union) to develop research into the role of the European External Action Service, namely the evolution of the EU’s effectiveness as a diplomatic actor on the global stage by examining how the EU conducts its diplomatic relations with third countries following the establishment of the EEAS:
• conducted 100+ elite interviews with diplomats, civil servants and civil society representatives;
• organized 10+ research panel at conferences in Europe & USA.
• coordinated small research team and developed research outputs (policy briefs, journal articles, book).
• co-edited Special Issue & manuscript. 
• delivered and defended the PhD thesis: Thesis: Practice and performance: EU diplomacy in Moldova, Ukraine and Belarus since the establishment of the EEAS, 2010-2015
• was awarded the PhD title in July, 2018
• managed the researh activities of the Centre for the Study of International Governance.
profile_positions.title: Marie Curie Early Stage Researcher / PhD candidate

profile_positions.description: I have provided research and logistical assistance to faculty staff; to the Administrative Government team;  coordinated the European scholars network between Maastricht University faculties and organised and coordinated a number of conferences.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant Department of Political Science

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for the oversight of the projects of our beneficiaries and activities, maintaining communication with both the beneficiaries and the board members, developing the Programme's Activity reports as well as develop teaching modules for our beneficiaries. I have gained knowledge in monitoring advocacy and partnership projects implemented by NGOs in Republic of Moldova. I have also developed my consultancy skills as I offered advise on their project implementation and budgeting. Besides this, I contributed to the development of the Annual Skills Course on Monitoring, Advocacy and Watchdog-ing for Moldovan NGOs and assisted in training cca 60 civic activists.
profile_positions.title: Civil Society Program Assistant

profile_positions.description: I have edited 15 issues of the Journal and coordinated the editorial team’s work. I have also contributed to the organization and coordination of activities related to undergoing projects of the CAPTES Center of Information, Education and Social Analyses
profile_positions.title: Editor in chief
